FuncDef:
The tunnel idle-cut command sets the idle-cut time of the L2TP tunnel.
The undo tunnel idle-cut command restores the default value.
By default, the idle-cut time of the L2TP tunnel is 60 seconds.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the idle-cut time of the tunnel in seconds.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 100000, in seconds. Zero indicates that the local end will never clear the tunnel.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When the idle-cut time of the L2TP tunnel is set to 0, it indicates that the local end will never clear the tunnel. However, if the tunnel is cleared by the peer end, the tunnel cannot be re-established any more.
Precautions
In the scenario where 1:1 inter-board backup is configured on the L2TP LNS, if a tunnel board is unbound from a backup group, the deletion of the tunnels on the tunnel board will be delayed. During the period when the deletion is delay, the tunnel idle-cut function does not take effect.
